The overlooked issue of domestic violence against elderly women
subhead: Among all women killed by their partners in France in 2024, 26% were over the age of 70, a figure that is on the rise. Yet, the murders of these women and the possible abuse that preceded them are poorly documented.

title: Four more arrested over Louvre heist, prosecutors say
Top court rules EU nations must mutually recognize same-sex marriages
subhead: The Court of Justice of the European Union said in a statement on Tuesday that any refusal to do this 'is contrary to EU law' and 'infringes not only the freedom to move and reside, but also the fundamental right to respect for private and family life.'

title: French government unveils rescue plan for struggling wine industry
subhead: The  Agriculture Ministry announced on Monday a €130 million aid package to fund the uprooting of vineyards and called on Brussels to mobilize the 'European crisis reserve.'

title: France's top architecture prize awarded to a school complex
subhead: Located in the Paris suburbs, the project by Gaëtan Le Penhuel & Associés creates shared spaces between the school and the recreation center.

title: Boualem Sansal: 'At my age, I am not about to learn to hold my tongue...'
subhead: The French-Algerian writer, who has been in France since November 18, has regained his freedom, including his freedom of speech. He recounts his yearlong detention in Algeria, discusses the remarks that led to his arrest, and reflects on the future of relations between France and Algeria.

Paris shops are squeezed by overtourism and real estate speculation
subhead: Between the needs of residents and the desire to attract tourists, commerces in the French capital have to strike a delicate balance. Failing to do so can be detrimental, as seen by the decline of the BHV department store.

title: France's cultural landmarks enter a time of costly makeovers
subhead: Lack of regular upkeep and the effects of climate change have forced many cultural institutions to undertake massive renovation projects, with costs expected to reach €5 billion over the next 10 years.

title: 'I told him about my day in real time': The couples who can't stop texting on WhatsApp
subhead: While couples in France exchange an average of nine text messages a day, some go far beyond, updating their partner in real time about every event in their day-to-day lives. Is this constant connection a sign of profound intimacy, or a need for control?
